title: I,US citizen, married illegal alien, after he got his green card, he abuses me, i want a divorce, can his Green card be revoked?
question: i thought the man loved me so i married him even tho he has been illegally living in the US for over 10 years and i am a US citizen, since he's been illegal for so long, it took him over 3 years to actually receive his green card, once he received his green card, his attitude / behavior toward me totally changed, i am heart broken now and don't want to stay in this marriage anymore, do i have a case to have his green card revoke? please help! thanks so much, =(
answers:
I'm sorry to hear you have been through such a difficult time with this relationship. Unfortunately, we see questions like this here way too often (see link to one from the other day).

I'm afraid the answer is the same here as it was to the last questioner - there is no way to actually revoke a green card. You can write a letter to USCIS, but saying what? Unless you have actual evidence that the marriage wasn't "real" - that the other person committed fraud in getting married only to get a green card - there may not be much point. My earlier answer gives some guidance on what this proof might be.

Good luck for a happier future.

I will agree with Stuart. You can always write but if he can prove his marriage was bona fide, he will keep his green card unless maybe if he was convicted of domestic violence. Even then....

Sorry for the bad news!
\
Good Luck
